name: test_compare_database
statusMessage:
AssertionError: jass_junaid & jass_siba Database columns are missing
assert False
statusTrace:
self = <test_db.TestDataBaseConnection object at 0x000001D2CD727650>

    @pytest.mark.compare_database
    def test_compare_database(self):
        assert_flag = True
        data_match = []
        missing_tables = []
        missing_column = []
        column_data_type = []
        sql_type_error_query_list = []
        type_error_col = []
    
        with open('util/host_detail.json') as file:
            data = json.load(file)
    
        old_database = data["old_dbname"]
        new_database = data["new_dbname"]
    
        for sql_query in Sql:
            data_base_connect = DataBaseConnection.get_db_data(DataBaseConnection.setup_connection(old_database),
                                                               sql_query.value)
            data_base_connect1 = DataBaseConnection.get_db_data(DataBaseConnection.setup_connection(new_database),
                                                                sql_query.value)
    
            data_query_list = list(set(data_base_connect1["sql_query_list"] + data_base_connect["sql_query_list"]))
    
            for sql in data_query_list:
    
                list_col = []
                try:
                    old_data = DataBaseConnection.get_db_data(DataBaseConnection.setup_connection(old_database),
                                                              sql)["db_data"]
                except psycopg2.errors.UndefinedTable:
                    assert_flag = False
                    missing_tables.append("Database: " + str(old_database) + "," + " Table Name : " + str(
                        sql.replace('select * from ', '')))
    
                    continue
    
                try:
                    new_data = DataBaseConnection.get_db_data(DataBaseConnection.setup_connection(new_database),
                                                              sql)["db_data"]
                except psycopg2.errors.UndefinedTable:
                    assert_flag = False
                    missing_tables.append("Database: " + str(new_database) + "," + " Table Name : " + str(
                        sql.replace('select * from ', '')))
                    continue
    
                if new_data.columns.difference(old_data.columns).any():
                    assert_flag = False
                    diff_col = new_data.columns.difference(old_data.columns)
                    missing_column.append("Instance: " + str(old_database) + "," + " Column: " + str(
                        diff_col.values) + "," + ' Missing Column in Database table : ' + str(
                        sql.replace('select * from ', '')))
    
                if old_data.columns.difference(new_data.columns).any():
                    assert_flag = False
                    diff_col = old_data.columns.difference(new_data.columns)
                    missing_column.append("Instance: " + str(new_database) + "," + " Column: " + str(
                        diff_col.values) + "," + ' Missing Column in Database table : ' + str(
                        sql.replace('select * from ', '')))
    
                filter_new_data = new_data.loc[:, ~new_data.columns.isin(list_col)]
                filter_old_data = old_data.loc[:, ~old_data.columns.isin(list_col)]
    
                df_diff = None
                if not filter_new_data.equals(filter_old_data):
                    try:
                        df_diff = pd.merge(filter_new_data, filter_old_data, how="outer", indicator=True)
                        df_diff = df_diff[df_diff['_merge'] != 'both']
                        df_diff = df_diff.rename(columns={'_merge': 'database'})
                        df_diff["database"] = df_diff["database"].str.replace('left_only',
                                                                              str(new_database)).str.replace(
                            'right_only', str(old_database))
                    except TypeError:
                        sql_type_error_query = "select * from " + sql.replace('select * from ', '')
                        sql_type_error_query_list.append(sql_type_error_query)
                        allure.attach("Table Name : " + str(sql.replace('select * from ', '')),
                                      name='Type Error in Database Table', attachment_type=allure.attachment_type.TEXT)
                        pass
    
                    if df_diff is not None and df_diff["database"].isin([str(old_database), str(new_database)]).any():
                        assert_flag = False
                        df_diff_html = df_diff.to_html()
                        allure.attach(df_diff_html, name='Difference Between Two Database tables : ' +
                                                         str(sql.replace('select * from ', '')),
                                      attachment_type=allure.attachment_type.HTML)
                else:
                    data_match.append('Database Data Match : ' + str(sql.replace('select * from ', '')))
    
            for sql_data_type in data_base_connect["sql_data_type_query_list"]:
                old_data = \
                    DataBaseConnection.get_db_data(DataBaseConnection.setup_connection(old_database), sql_data_type)[
                        "db_data"]
                new_data = \
                    DataBaseConnection.get_db_data(DataBaseConnection.setup_connection(new_database), sql_data_type)[
                        "db_data"]
    
                common_columns = set(old_data['column_name']).intersection(set(new_data['column_name']))
    
                for column in common_columns:
                    db_type1 = old_data.loc[old_data['column_name'] == column, 'data_type'].iloc[0]
                    db_type2 = new_data.loc[new_data['column_name'] == column, 'data_type'].iloc[0]
                    if db_type1 != db_type2:
                        assert_flag = False
                        sql_table = "select column_name, data_type from information_schema.columns where table_name = "
                        df = f"From Table: {str(sql_data_type.replace(sql_table, ''))}, Column '{column}' has " \
                             f"different datatypes: Database 1: {db_type1},  Database 2: {db_type2}"
                        column_data_type.append(df)
    
            def dict_to_tuple(d):
                if isinstance(d, dict):
                    result = []
                    for k, v in d.items():
                        tuple_v = dict_to_tuple(v)
                        result.append((k, tuple_v))
                    return tuple(result)
                elif isinstance(d, list):
                    return tuple(dict_to_tuple(x) for x in d)
                else:
                    return d
    
            for sql_type in sql_type_error_query_list:
                old_data = DataBaseConnection.get_db_data(DataBaseConnection.setup_connection(old_database),
                                                          sql_type)["db_data"]
                new_data = DataBaseConnection.get_db_data(DataBaseConnection.setup_connection(new_database),
                                                          sql_type)["db_data"]
    
                old_col_to_tuple = old_data.applymap(dict_to_tuple)
                new_col_to_tuple = new_data.applymap(dict_to_tuple)
    
                diff_col = old_col_to_tuple.columns.difference(new_col_to_tuple.columns)
    
                type_error_col.extend(diff_col.values)
    
                filter_old_data = old_col_to_tuple.loc[:, ~old_col_to_tuple.columns.isin(type_error_col)]
                filter_new_data = new_col_to_tuple.loc[:, ~new_col_to_tuple.columns.isin(type_error_col)]
    
                df_diff = pd.merge(filter_new_data, filter_old_data, how="outer", indicator=True)
    
                # abc = pd.concat([])
    
                df_diff = df_diff[df_diff["_merge"] != "both"]
                df_diff = df_diff.rename(columns={'_merge': 'database'})
                df_diff["database"] = df_diff["database"].str.replace('left_only', str(new_database)).str.replace(
                    'right_only', str(old_database))
    
                allure.attach(df_diff.to_html(), name='Difference between two Database tables : ' +
                                                      str(sql_type.replace('select * from ', '')),
                              attachment_type=allure.attachment_type.HTML)
    
                DataBaseConnection.close_connection(DataBaseConnection.setup_connection(old_database))
                DataBaseConnection.close_connection(DataBaseConnection.setup_connection(new_database))
    
            database_data_match = '\n'.join(data_match)
            allure.attach(str(database_data_match), name='Database Data Match',
                          attachment_type=allure.attachment_type.TEXT)
            missing_tables = '\n'.join(missing_tables)
            allure.attach(str(missing_tables), name='Missing Tables from database',
                          attachment_type=allure.attachment_type.TEXT)
            missing_column = '\n'.join(missing_column)
            allure.attach(str(missing_column), name='Missing Column in Database table',
                          attachment_type=allure.attachment_type.TEXT)
            database_column_datatype = '\n'.join(column_data_type)
            allure.attach(str(database_column_datatype), name='Database Columns Datatype not matching',
                          attachment_type=allure.attachment_type.TEXT)
    
            # Check for missing tables and other conditions
            if len(missing_tables) != 0:
                assert assert_flag, f"{old_database} & {new_database} Database tables details are not matching"
    
            # Additional assertions based on other conditions
            # Example: Check for missing columns
            if len(missing_column) != 0:
>               assert assert_flag, f"{old_database} & {new_database} Database columns are missing"
